'''Coranar''' meaning literally "sun-round", a name given by the [[Elves]] to a single [[Years of the Sun|solar year]].<ref name=cal>{{App|Calendars}}</ref><ref>{{PM|IV}}, pp. 126-127</ref>

The [[Valar]] intended a Year of the Sun to be exactly 350 full days, being a 1/10 fraction of a [[Years of the Trees|Year of the Trees]]. However the [[Sun]] and [[Moon]] were slower than expected in their passage than the Valar had intended, and in one coranar, the Sun turns 365.25 times instead of 350, or approximately 1/9.58 of a Year of the Trees.<ref>{{MR|P2}}</ref>

Although the [[Dúnedain]] (and the [[Hobbits]]) divided the coranar in 365 days, the extra hours (5 hours, 48 minutes, 46 seconds) accumulated a deficit after centuries; to remedy this, some calendars included a "leap-year" every four years (see: [[enderi]], [[Overlithe]]).

144 coranari made a [[yén]] which was the basic unit of time for the [[immortality|immortal]] [[Elves]].
